intro: Aylostera flavistyla, commonly known as the golden-styled aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Aylostera flavistyla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
